eventDescription.name: Swap
eventDescription.description: Event emitted when a swap occurs in the USDC/DAI Uniswap V3 pool. USDC has 6 decimals and corresponds to amount0; DAI has 18 decimals and corresponds to amount1. Positive values indicate tokens being sent into the pool (sold), negative values indicate tokens being received from the pool (bought). The raw values must be adjusted according to their respective decimals

params.name: sender
params.description: The address that initiated the swap call and received the callback

params.name: recipient
params.description: The address that received the output tokens from the swap

params.name: amount0
params.description: The change in USDC (token0) balance of the pool. Positive for USDC sent into the pool (sold), negative for USDC received from the pool (bought). Divide by 1e6 to convert to USDC amount

params.name: amount1
params.description: The change in DAI (token1) balance of the pool. Positive for DAI sent into the pool (sold), negative for DAI received from the pool (bought). Divide by 1e18 to convert to DAI amount

params.name: sqrtPriceX96
params.description: The square root of the pool's price after the swap, encoded as a Q64.96 fixed-point number. This value can be used to calculate the current price of the pool

params.name: liquidity
params.description: The amount of virtual liquidity in the tick range where the current price resides, after the swap. Represents the total liquidity available for trading at the current price

params.name: tick
params.description: The tick showing the pool's price after the swap. Each tick corresponds to a specific price level
